ygData.subject: RE: [EQ_women] Crossdressing in Eq...
ygData.msgSnippet: I usually can t tell who is a woman and who is a man. Take for instance, my guild leader is a female but she s actually a man.  She only has one male character
ygData.messageBody:
I usually can't tell who is a woman and who is a man. Take for instance, my
guild leader is a female but she's actually a man. She only has one male
character though. So it's tough. I thought she was a female she was TOTALLY
like a female but she's a male.

Some of them, are dead giveaways...but usually I can't tell.

I never play a man either although I want to. I just can't think of any
manly names

Soril

-----Original Message-----
From: Elizabeth Adams [mailto:ea9999@...]
Sent: Monday, December 11, 2000 11:14 AM
To: EQ_women@egroups.com
Subject: [EQ_women] Crossdressing in Eq...


I know this issue has been covered before, but I recently read an
article by a student studying psychology (www.students.haverford.edu)
based on his own survey of players. He calculated that half the
female characters on EQ at any time are played by males, but very
few women play male personae. This seems odd, but I have to say that
I have very little interest in playing male characters, and it seems
that I am far from alone in this. Is our researcher correct, do you
think?

As an aside, I wondered if I could tell which females were male, and
I conclude that, on the whole, I can't, if they don't want me to.
Sure, there are boys who give the game away with abuse and bad
language (or am I just stereotyping boyish behaviour?) and a
proportion making their gender clear (the surname Crossdresser was a
giveaway,I though ;), but on the whole, I have no idea. To be honest,
the only ones I really assume to be women are those who keep going
afk to deal with domestic issues; more stereotyping?

Just a few thoughts, if anyone is still there.....
Love,

Liz, aka Gyngermynx, ranger of the 27th hunt, Quellious
